title: Debbie Chase
text:
Debbie Chase (born 29 July 1966) is a former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. She debuted for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Black Ferns</a> against the <a href="Netherlands%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Netherlands</a> at the <a href="RugbyFest%201990">RugbyFest 1990</a>. She led the first Haka to be performed by a women's team at the <a href="1991%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">1991 Women's Rugby World Cup</a>.
Career.
Chase has represented New Zealand in three different codes; <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and <a href="softball">softball</a>. She has also represented Canterbury in athletics, volleyball, basketball, rugby sevens, football and volleyball.
In 1998, she was a part of the <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Kiwi Ferns</a> that beat a touring Great Britain in a <a href="1998%20Great%20Britain%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20League%20Tour%20of%20New%20Zealand">three test series</a>.
